intro: Fimbristylis laevissima, commonly known as the smooth bristle grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its root system is fibrous and helps stabilize soil in wetland habitats. Fimbristylis laevissima plays an important ecological role in maintaining the health of wetland ecosystems.
